definition: to repatriate (e.g. prisoners of war)/to send back

sentences.english: Well done. Find out some other US officials and repatriate them.
sentences.chinese: 幹得好，把其他美國官員揪出來，然後遣返。

sentences.english: Laos has insisted that all who return will be resettled peacefully.
sentences.chinese: 老撾則強調所有被遣返的難民都將會得到妥善安置。

sentences.english: The Japanese prisoners of war were repatriated to their homeland after the war.
sentences.chinese: 日本戰俘於戰後被遣返回國。

sentences.english: Tugboat towing ports, no sewage, there is repatriation facilities.
sentences.chinese: 港口有拖輪拖曳，無排污，有遣返設施。

sentences.english: A number of vietnamese boat people staged a protest against repatriation.
sentences.chinese: 不少越南船民抗議遣返原地。

sentences.english: SanJuanKid 41 minutes ago "12 years later, China's most-wanted sent back."
sentences.chinese: 12年後，中國的頭號通緝犯被遣返。

sentences.english: Is there a deportee under your escort?
sentences.chinese: 請問你們警方是押解了一名遣返人員嗎？

sentences.english: This is variously dressed up with talk of the "Swiss model" or of repatriating powers.
sentences.chinese: 這是經過精心修飾的談論“瑞士模型”或遣返的力量。

sentences.english: Is China considering having them repatriated?
sentences.chinese: 中方是否考慮將其遣返？

sentences.english: Till April of 1946, all the captives were repatriated .
sentences.chinese: 截至1946年4月，日俘全部被遣返回國。

sentences.english: Is China going to repatriate these North Koreans within the Chinese territory?
sentences.chinese: 中國是否會將中國境內的朝鮮人遣返回國？

sentences.english: I want to talk to our embassy officers. I need repatriation.
sentences.chinese: 我想見使館官員，我想遣返回國。

sentences.english: Spain agreed to manage their immediate repatriations.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙則同意安排把船上乘客立刻遣返。

sentences.english: In case transfer is not effective, the employer shall be responsible for the repatriation of the CARETAKER.
sentences.chinese: 如未能順利轉出，僱主應負責受僱者之遣返事宜。

sentences.english: Calderoni said that developments in repatriation rules would affect the size of the dividend.
sentences.chinese: 卡爾德羅尼說遣返回國規則的發展將影響股息的大小。

definition: to escort a criminal under guard (in former times)
illegal immigration/to stowaway (on a ship)/to steal across the international border/to run a blockade
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
